title: [BUG] TBATS model fails when forecast horizon is greater than number of training data points
body:
TBATS model from sktime 0.7.0 fails with the following error if the forecast horizon is greater than number of training data points. Attaching error screenshot and reproducible code here.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34185789/180009313-7dde92ef-450b-4fde-b0cf-e0fa44cd7f65.png)


```
# Imports
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# Logger
import logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

# create some monthly time series data with random values
length_of_time_series = 24
seasonal_periods = 12
ts_array = np.random.randint(0, 100, length_of_time_series)

# convert numpy array to series
train = pd.Series(ts_array).astype('float64')

from sktime.forecasting.tbats import TBATS

tbats_model = TBATS(
    use_box_cox=False,
    use_trend=True,
    use_damped_trend=False,
    sp=seasonal_periods,
    use_arma_errors=False,
)

tbats_model.fit(train)

# works fine - when num points to forecast is less than or equal to train datapoints
num_points_to_forecast = 12
fcst_horizon = np.arange(1, num_points_to_forecast + 1)
pred = tbats_model.predict(fh=fcst_horizon)
logger.info("-- Predictions --")
logger.info(pred)

# throws ValueError - when num points to forecast is greater than train datapoints
num_points_to_forecast = 25
fcst_horizon = np.arange(1, num_points_to_forecast + 1)
try:
    pred = tbats_model.predict(fh=fcst_horizon)
except Exception as e:
    logger.exception(e)
```

Kindly suggest workarounds if any, thanks in advance!
